revised_title: Development of the Skeleton and Olfactory Structures in the Apterix
tldr: The authors studied the development of the skeleton and olfactory structures in the Apteryx, a bird with reptilian characteristics. They observed seven stages before hatching and provided detailed descriptions of the skull's structure, including the olfactory capsules, turbinals, and the presence of vestigial cartilage of Jacobson's organ. This research contributes to the understanding of the morphology and evolution of archaic bird types.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Zoology > Ornithology
